answerText: Franck-Condon principle [10] The Franck-Condon principle explains the relative intensities of electronic transitions involved in this phenomenon. Its namesake resonance energy transfer occurs when an excited chromophore transfers its energy to a second chromophore, which releases light of a different wavelength than that absorbed by the first molecule.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Chicago Culture Heroes and Psychopomps | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Its namesake factor gives an indication of the intensity of spectral lines and is the square of the vibrational overlap integral. FTPE:   [10] Name this principle that states that nuclear motions are slow on the timescale of electronic transitions.
